radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the temporal bone
radiographic_examinations.findings: Hyperdense soft-tissue mass, 3.2 cm by 2.5 cm by 4 cm, against the lateral aspect of the left mastoid bone, with opacification of the left mastoid air cells and portions of the middle-ear cavity, and retraction of the tympanic membrane.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the brain and temporal bone
radiographic_examinations.findings: Enhancing soft-tissue mass, 4.5 cm by 2.8 cm by 4.5 cm, in the periauricular region of the left ear, with opacification of the left mastoid air cells and middle-ear cavity.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The mass increased in size from the CT scan, completely obliterating the lumen of the external auditory canal.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Bulky mass that completely obliterates the lumen of the external auditory canal, mildly hypointense relative to the brain on T1-weighted images, heterogeneous on T2-weighted images, and showing moderate heterogeneous enhancement.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The mass increased in size compared to the previous MRI, obliterating the external auditory canal.
